## Description
The **Sign Documents **task allows to sign documents with the configured signing profile. The profile will be used to create a specific type of signature (CAdES, XAdES, or PAdES).

> Important

B2G invoices must always be signed, but it is possible to not sign B2B invoices in an Electronic Invoicing workflow.

> **Note for internal users**

For a detailed technical reference, see: [bp3/odp3.component-fixture.sign-documents.v2](https://code.doxee.com/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=145604785).

## Configuration
![](data:image/png;base64,)

- In the **Alias **field, enter the name of the task that will be displayed in the workflow.

- In the **Signing profile **field, enter the profile code provided by the R&amp;D team.

> **Note for internal users**

To request a signing profile on DP3, open an Access Management ticket providing the information obtained creating a signing profile in the Aruba ASB System.

## Input
The tasks expects the files to be signed as input.

Depending on the provided profile, different signature types can be used for different file types, as detailed in the following table:

**Signature type**

**Possible configuration**

**Input file type**

**Notes**

**CAdES**

DETACHED

*ENVELOPING (not*

*available yet)*

Any document extension

The CAdES signature is applied by the Aruba server.

**XAdES**

ENVELOPED ENVELOPING

*DETACHED (not available yet)*

XML

The XAdES signature is applied by the Aruba server.

**PAdES**

ENVELOPING

PDF

The PAdES signature is applied by the Aruba server.

**CERTIFICATE**

Not yet available

Any document extension

The certificate signature is applied by Open SSL with the certificate saved on DP3.

## Output
The task will return the signed documents:

**Signature type**

**Output file type**

**Notes**

**CAdES**

P7M

The system appends the *.p7m *extention to the signed documents (for example, *Filetest.doc *will became *Filet est.doc.p7m*).

**XAdES**

XML

The name of the signed output documents is unchanged.

**PAdES**

PDF

The name of the signed output documents is unchanged.
